clinical_study.brief_title: Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) in the Primary Motor Cortex in Healthy Individuals
clinical_study.official_title: Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) in the Primary Motor Cortex and Its Effects on Sensitivity, Pressure Pain Threshold, and Electromyographic Activity in Healthy Individuals: A Quasi-experimental Single-blind Sham-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The main aim of this study is to assess the short-term effects of active-tDCS (a-tDCS) on the M1 regarding sensorimotor variables such as discriminative sensation, pressure pain threshold and electromyographic activity compared with a sham-tDCS (s-tDCS) in healthy individuals. The main objective was to determine whether there were clinically relevant changes generated by tDCS and if they were superior to a sham intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Pressure pain threshold through an algometer
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in pressure pain threshold immediately at the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Pressure pain threshold has been defined as the minimal amount of pressure at which a sense of pressure first changes to pain or discomfort

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in tactile acuity threshold immediately at the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Tactile acuity threshold is an important variable to know the somatosensory state and Von Frey monofilaments and Aesthesiometer were used

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in electromyographic activity immediately at the end of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: The activity of surface electromyography (sEMG) during an isometric maximal voluntary contraction was measured in the biceps brachii and rectus femoris.

intervention.intervention_name: Sooma transcranial direct current stimulation device
intervention.description: This group received brain training through transcranial direct current for 20 minutes.

intervention.intervention_name: Placebo Sooma transcranial direct current stimulation device
intervention.description: This group received sham brain training through transcranial direct current for 20 minutes. The current is active for 15 seconds and then switches off until the intervention is finished.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- asymptomatic participants
- men and women aged 18 to 65 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- insomnia
- nausea
- headache
- pregnancy
- use of painkillers in the last 24 hours
- presence of metal inside the head
- pacemaker
- wound on the area of electrodes' application
- drug consumption; (j) recent application of tDCS
- psychiatric disease impeding understanding of the study.
